description: Smallest number x such that cototient(x) = 2^n.
comments: Since the cototient of 3*2^n is 2^(n+1), upper bounds are given by A007283(n-1). [From _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 13 2008]A058764(n+1) is the number of different walks with n steps in the graph G = ({1,2,3,4}, {{1,2}, {2,3}, {3,4}}). [Aldo GonzÃ¡lez Lorenzo, Feb 27 2012]
example: a(5)=48, cototient(48)=48-Phi(48)=48-16=32. For n>2 a(n)=3.2^(n-1); largest solutions =2^(n+1); Prime factors of solutions: 2 and Mersenne-primes were found only.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {x = 1; while(x - eulerphi(x) != 2^n, x++); x;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 11 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 02 2001
